page.title: 06Tring Museum
page.content: Lionel Walter Rothschild was born in 1868 and soon became very interested in natural history.At the age of seven his intention was to create a museum. He had help from a skilled taxidermist named Alfred Minall.By the time of Lionel's 21st birthday he had such a huge collection that his father was persuaded to build two cottages, one for Minall and one for a library and display gallery. The museum grew in the years and because of this two more people were to help run it called Ernst Hartert and Karl Jorden. Today Tring Museum which is in Akeman Street has 120,000 visitors each year and some of the animals which Lionel first collected can still be seen today.People come from all over the world to see the animals.
